Class JWTTokenProvider

java.lang.Object
autoberlo.autoberlo.token.JWTTokenProvider
@Component public class JWTTokenProvider extends Object
JWT Token Provider for generating, validating, and managing JWT tokens. This class provides methods to create and validate JWT tokens, extract authorities, and handle authentication details.
Author:
Mandrusz Zsolt, Németh Marcell, Szász Kristóf

  • Method Details

    • generateJwtToken

      public String generateJwtToken(PermissionCollector permissionCollector)
      Generates a JWT token using the given PermissionCollector.
      Parameters:
      permissionCollector - the PermissionCollector containing the user's details and authorities
      Returns:
      a signed JWT token string

    • getAuthorities

      public List<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> getAuthorities(String token)
      Extracts authorities from a JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to extract authorities from
      Returns:
      a list of GrantedAuthority objects

    • getAuthentication

      public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication getAuthentication(String username, List<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> authorities, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Creates an Authentication object using the provided username, authorities, and HttpServletRequest.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the authenticated user
      authorities - the list of authorities granted to the user
      request - the HttpServletRequest for additional authentication details
      Returns:
      an Authentication object for the user

    • isTokenValid

      public boolean isTokenValid(String username, String token)
      Validates a JWT token by checking if it is not expired and if the username matches.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to validate against
      token - the JWT token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid, false otherwise

    • getSubject

      public String getSubject(String token)
      Extracts the subject (username) from the JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to extract the subject from
      Returns:
      the username (subject) from the token
